definition: (of one's name, reputation etc) to be immortalized (idiom)/to leave a mark for generations to come
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: As a people's hero, Dong Cunrui has a niche in the temple of fame.
sentences.chinese: 董存瑞作爲一名人民英雄而流芳百世。

sentences.english: The scientist's name will live on from generation to generation.
sentences.chinese: 這位科學家的名字將流芳百世。

sentences.english: Mozart is dead but his music lives on .
sentences.chinese: 莫扎特死了，但他的音樂流芳百世。

sentences.english: His dream was to be an architect and to leave his name in posterity.
sentences.chinese: 他夢想成爲一名建築師，流芳百世。

sentences.english: In the world market exist a plus products with low quality goods, but the same word "investment" mean an product that lasts.
sentences.chinese: 但是既然是“投資”，意味着它應該流芳百世。

sentences.english: It should ensure Michael goes down in history as the greatest artist of all time.
sentences.chinese: 這使得邁克爾成爲史上最偉大的藝術家流芳百世。

sentences.english: A fair death honour the whole life.

definition: lit. reputation will go down in history (idiom); fig. achievements will earn eternal glory
a good reputation to last a hundred generations
to have one's name go down in history as a byword for infamy (idiom)
a good reputation to last down the generations
for all eternity/throughout all ages/eternity (used in an elegiac couplet, wreath etc dedicated to the dead)
lit. to erect a stele and write a biography (idiom)/to monumentalize/to glorify/to sing the praises of
to become known far and wide (idiom)/famous
